description: Jorge Rafael Videla oversaw a ruthless campaign of political killings and forced disappearances during Argentina’s so-called Dirty War against dissidents in the mid-1970s.
title: Jorge Rafael Videla, Argentine Military Leader, Dies
title_page: Jorge Rafael Videla, Argentine Military Leader, Dies - The New York Times
maintext:
Slide 1 of 8,
Jorge Rafael Videla, the military junta leader who oversaw a ruthless campaign of political killings and forced disappearances during Argentina’s so-called Dirty War against dissidents in the mid-1970s, died Friday in the Marcos Paz Prison in Buenos Aires, where he was serving a life sentence for crimes against humanity. He was 87.
General Videla in 1978 in Argentina.
